Award.AwardTitle: NSF Meeting Proposal: 2013 Critical Zone Observatories (CZO) Annual Meeting (New era of an expanded and formalized network)
Award.AbstractNarration:
This is a request to support a Critical Zone Observatories (CZO) meeting on October 1 - 2, 2013 at NSF Headquarters, Arlington, VA. The meeting will include NSF staff as well as two representatives from each of ten NSF-funded Critical Zone Observatories, 5 CZO Steering Committee members, and the CZO national coordinator.

The meeting will highlight research results and plans from the existing and new CZOs as a status report to NSF and as a starting point for discussions of intensified collaboration within the new expanded CZO network. The primary goals of the meeting are to identify and discuss research and education challenges in Critical Zone science of common interest within the expanded network, to vitalize collaborative activities, and to consider issues associated with common measurements, data management, and observatory management plans. Ample time for planning and interaction with the new CZOs is included.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The October 2013 meeting highlighted research results and plans from the existing and new Critical Zone Observatories (CZO) as status reports to NSF, and as a starting point for discussions of intensified collaboration within the new expanded CZO network. The attendees worked:

1) to identify and discuss research and education challenges in CZ science of common interest within the expanded network;

2) to vitalize collaborative activities;

3) to consider issues associated with common measurements, data management, and observatory management plans.

A central goal of the meeting was that by providing a forum for the expanded U.S. CZO PI team to share and discuss strategies of common measurement, data management and modeling, this sharing itself would drive the move toward standardized methods and community models. Thus a major focus of the meeting was the topic of common measurements and the broader theme of collaborative cross-network activity – the research and educational initiatives that will help to determine and constrain those measurements and activities that need to be accomplished in common. Substantial discussion of cross-network research questions occurred, organized around the topics of stream chemistry, extreme events, bedrock/nutrient relationships, CZTope, vegetation-water-regolith interactions, redox-greenhouse gas budgets, and low-altitude remote sensing. Working groups for information management, modeling, common measurements, education and outreach, and criticalzone.org were established along with a chair for each.

Twenty three presentations were made through the course of the meeting - highlights of those talks include one by David Lesmes (DOE) and a stage setting talk on common measurements by Jon Chorover U. Arizona).
